intro: Hieracium iremelense, commonly known as the Iremelense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium iremelense is often found in lowland areas and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
